title: How to Make 2‐Ingredient Ice Cream

steps.headline: Whip the heavy cream with an electric mixer.
steps.description: In a large bowl, beat the heavy cream for about 2-3 minutes on high speed. Beat until stiff peaks begin to form.

steps.headline: Slowly combine in the condensed milk.
steps.description: Mix on low speed until fully combined. Some people suggest adding a teaspoon of vanilla extract, if desired. While this is optional and makes the recipe 3 ingredient ice cream, it adds a good amount of flavor to the dessert.

steps.headline: Bring the speed to a higher level and keep mixing.
steps.description: Continue beating and mixing until the ice cream base has stiff peaks and is thick.

steps.headline: Pour the ice cream mixture into a container.
steps.description: Scrape out all the mixture into a large, airtight container. Cover it with aluminium foil or close it tightly with a lid. If you'd like, you can flavor the ice cream base and add extra desired ingredients. Crumbled cake or cupcakes, crumbled cheesecake, breakfast cereal, Oreo cookies, and fruit puree are all good ingredients to add to the ice cream.

steps.headline: Freeze the ice cream for 6 hours till overnight.
Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the ice cream out of the container and place it in a serving dish. Garnish with any desired toppings and enjoy! Any toppings can be added on top of the ice cream. Try ice cream syrups, nuts, sprinkles, fresh fruit, chocolate chips, etc.

steps.headline: Pour half of the milk in a saucepan or milk scalder.
Add the chopped chocolate to the milk.
Melt the chocolate over low heat.
steps.description: Stir frequently with a spoon, heating until the chocolate melts. Take caution not to over-cook and scald the chocolate. Don't wait for it to boil; Only heat it until the chocolate fully melts.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker.
steps.description: Following your manufacturer's instructions, make the chocolate ice cream and place it in an airtight container or loaf pan.

steps.headline: Freeze the ice cream for 6 hours till overnight.
Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the ice cream out of the container or loaf pan and place it in a serving dish. Garnish with any desired toppings and enjoy! The chocolate ice cream can be topped with  edible cookie dough balls, chocolate syrup, a chopped chocolate bar, or whipped cream.

steps.headline: Peel the bananas and discard the peels.
Slice the bananas into 2-inch chunks.
steps.description: Place them in a freezer-proof container or Ziploc bag.

steps.headline: Freeze the bananas for about 6 hours until solid.
Blend the bananas in an electric blender.
steps.description: Mix until the bananas are well-mashed, taking about 2-3 minutes on high speed.

steps.headline: Add the heavy cream or milk and mix once more.
Place the banana mixture into a freezer-proof container.
steps.description: Close tightly with a lid or cover with plastic wrap.

steps.headline: Freeze the banana ice cream for about 6 hours till overnight.
Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the ice cream out of the container and place it in a serving dish. Garnish with any desired toppings and enjoy! The banana ice cream can be topped with ice cream syrup, whipped cream, chocolate chips, and banana slices.

steps.description: Close tightly with a lid or cover with plastic wrap.

text: Simple 2 Ingredient Ice Cream Whip the heavy cream with an electric mixer. In a large bowl, beat the heavy cream for about 2-3 minutes on high speed. Beat until stiff peaks begin to form. Slowly combine in the condensed milk. Mix on low speed until fully combined. Some people suggest adding a teaspoon of vanilla extract, if desired. While this is optional and makes the recipe 3 ingredient ice cream, it adds a good amount of flavor to the dessert. Bring the speed to a higher level and keep mixing. Continue beating and mixing until the ice cream base has stiff peaks and is thick. Pour the ice cream mixture into a container. Scrape out all the mixture into a large, airtight container. Cover it with aluminium foil or close it tightly with a lid. If you'd like, you can flavor the ice cream base and add extra desired ingredients. Crumbled cake or cupcakes, crumbled cheesecake, breakfast cereal, Oreo cookies, and fruit puree are all good ingredients to add to the ice cream. Freeze the ice cream for 6 hours till overnight.  Serve. Scoop the ice cream out of the container and place it in a serving dish. Garnish with any desired toppings and enjoy! Any toppings can be added on top of the ice cream. Try ice cream syrups, nuts, sprinkles, fresh fruit, chocolate chips, etc. 2 Ingredient Chocolate Ice Cream Pour half of the milk in a saucepan or milk scalder.  Add the chopped chocolate to the milk.  Melt the chocolate over low heat. Stir frequently with a spoon, heating until the chocolate melts. Take caution not to over-cook and scald the chocolate. Don't wait for it to boil; Only heat it until the chocolate fully melts. Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker. Following your manufacturer's instructions, make the chocolate ice cream and place it in an airtight container or loaf pan. Freeze the ice cream for 6 hours till overnight.  Serve. Scoop the ice cream out of the container or loaf pan and place it in a serving dish. Garnish with any desired toppings and enjoy! The chocolate ice cream can be topped with  edible cookie dough balls, chocolate syrup, a chopped chocolate bar, or whipped cream. 2 Ingredient Banana Ice Cream Peel the bananas and discard the peels.  Slice the bananas into 2-inch chunks. Place them in a freezer-proof container or Ziploc bag. Freeze the bananas for about 6 hours until solid.  Blend the bananas in an electric blender. Mix until the bananas are well-mashed, taking about 2-3 minutes on high speed. Add the heavy cream or milk and mix once more.  Place the banana mixture into a freezer-proof container. Close tightly with a lid or cover with plastic wrap. Freeze the banana ice cream for about 6 hours till overnight.  Serve. Scoop the ice cream out of the container and place it in a serving dish. Garnish with any desired toppings and enjoy! The banana ice cream can be topped with ice cream syrup, whipped cream, chocolate chips, and banana slices. 2 Ingredient Strawberry Ice Cream Blend the bananas in an electric blender. Mix until the bananas are well-mashed, taking about 2-3 minutes on high speed. Add the strawberries and blend once more. Mix on high speed until the mixture is creamy and smooth. Place the strawberry mixture into a freezer-proof container. Close tightly with a lid or cover with plastic wrap. Freeze the strawberry ice cream for about 6 hours till overnight. This step is optional, if you prefer soft-serve ice cream you do not need to freeze it. Serve. Scoop the ice cream out of the container and place it in a serving dish. Garnish with any desired toppings and enjoy! The strawberry ice cream can be topped with whipped cream, freshly sliced strawberries, banana pieces, strawberry syrup, and/or chocolate chips. 2 Ingredient Peanut Butter Ice Cream Peel the bananas and discard the peels.  Slice the bananas into 2-inch chunks. Place them in a freezer-proof container or Ziploc bag. Freeze the bananas for about 6 hours until solid.  Blend the bananas in an electric blender. Mix until the bananas are well-mashed, taking about 2-3 minutes on high speed. Add the peanut butter and mix once more.  Place the banana mixture into a freezer-proof container. Close tightly with a lid or cover with plastic wrap. Freeze the banana ice cream for about 6 hours till overnight.  Serve. Scoop the ice cream out of the container and place it in a serving dish. Garnish with any desired toppings and enjoy! The peanut butter ice cream can be topped with ice cream syrups, peanut butter chips, a chopped chocolate bar, or chocolate shavings. 2 Ingredient Coconut Ice Cream Whip the heavy cream with an electric mixer. In a large bowl, beat the heavy cream for about 2-3 minutes on high speed. Beat until stiff peaks begin to form. Slowly combine in the cream of coconut. Mix on low speed until fully combined. The mixture should look fluffy and have a few stiff peaks. Place the coconut mixture into an airtight container or loaf pan.  Freeze the ice cream for 6 hours till overnight.  Serve. Scoop the ice cream out of the container or loaf pan and place it in a serving dish. Garnish with any desired toppings and enjoy! The coconut ice cream can be topped with roasted coconut flakes, vanilla syrup, chocolate chips, or pineapple pieces. 2 Ingredient Soda Ice Cream Pour the soda and milk into an ice cream maker. Following your manufacturer's instructions, make the soda ice cream until it comes out creamy and soft. Place the soda ice cream into an airtight container or loaf pan.  Freeze the ice cream for a few hours till overnight. This step is optional if you prefer soft-serve ice cream, but freezing it will help firm the ice cream. Serve. Scoop the ice cream out of the container or loaf pan and place it in a serving dish. Garnish with any desired toppings and enjoy! The soda ice cream can be topped with fresh berries, lemon juice, whipped cream, or chocolate chips. 2 Ingredient Peach Ice Cream Blend the peaches in an electric blender. Mix until the peaches are well-mashed, taking about 2-3 minutes on high speed. Add the milk and mix once more.  Place the peach mixture into a freezer-proof container. Close tightly with a lid or cover with plastic wrap. Freeze the peach ice cream for about 6 hours till overnight.  Serve. Scoop the ice cream out of the container and place it in a serving dish. Garnish with any desired toppings and enjoy! The peach ice cream can be topped with whipped cream, fresh berries, coconut flakes, or a chopped chocolate bar. 2 Ingredient Cherry Ice Cream Blend the cherries in an electric blender. Mix until the cherries are well-mashed, taking about 2-3 minutes on high speed. Add the milk and mix once more.  Place the cherry mixture into a freezer-proof container. Close tightly with a lid or cover with plastic wrap. Freeze the cherry ice cream for about 6 hours till overnight.  Serve. Scoop the ice cream out of the container and place it in a serving dish. Garnish with any desired toppings and enjoy! The cherry ice cream can be topped with strawberry syrup, dried fruit, sprinkles, or whipped cream.
